#聚落計畫 #thevillageproject
💡白南準，另類解讀／第四次工業革命的幻相
日期：2019.11.27~11.28，13:30~16:30
地點：國立臺北藝術大學關渡美術館
講者：楊智允
Nam June Paik, Alternatives／The Illustion of the Fourth Industrial Revolution
Date: 2019.11.27~11.28, 13:30~16:30
Venue: Kuandu Museum of Fine Arts, TNUA
Lecturer: Ji Yoon Yang

 報名連結：https://forms.gle/EpsP4UwGjtDKtqmV6

 💡活動說明
🔦白南準，另類解讀
在白南準去世之後，韓國政府試圖將他標示為國家的創意英雄。正如史密森尼美國美術館館長伊莉莎白．布朗所言：「如果說畢卡索是矗立於20世紀上半葉的巨人，那麼白南準便是這世紀下半葉所有新思潮的重心所在。」白南準藝術中心首任館長稱他為「值得稱頌千年的文化偶像。」然而，他在韓國國立現當代美術館的大型影像作品〈多多益善〉，因作品上方發生短路問題進行安檢，爾後宣布因有引起火災之疑慮，於是自2018年2月起此作品處於全面關機狀態。白南準被尊崇為國家英雄，但其作品卻消失了。他曾留下著名的自評說：「黃禍，是我嗎？」，關於白南準的作品是否有其他可能的解讀方式呢？

 🔦第四次工業革命的幻相
現今韓國政府將第四次工業革命宣傳為國家的機會，韓國媒體藝術家們在第四次工業革命的標語下接受大型裝置作品的委託計畫，國立現當代美術館也舉辦媒體藝術展以宣示它的到來。第四次工業革命是否真的已經上路？科學與技術的發展是否真能帶來更舒適且富裕的生活？藝術家又該如何應對科技發展所帶來當前的勞工及社會問題等現象？

 💡講者簡介
楊智允目前為首爾替代空間LOOP的總監，以及Sound Effect Seoul的協同主持人。在參與2008至2009年de
Appel策展課程之後，她曾擔任首爾擬態博物館的首席策展人和Corner Art
Space負責人。楊智允也曾參與多項出版的編輯與撰寫，其著作包含《論策展》、《聲音與藝術》、《韓國博物館》及《世界博物館》等。她關注的議題主要為透過無線電通訊、聲音、表演與媒體藝術等實驗藝術家和作品，與大眾進行新的社會議題交流。其策展計畫包括：革命不會被轉播（與芭魯克．高特列白共同策展，Arko藝術中心，2018），不真實的迷思（國立亞洲文化殿堂，2016），未來的陰影：韓國錄像藝術家聯展（與海納．荷塔貝共同策展，布加勒斯特當代美術館，2013），口對口對口：首爾當代藝術展（與安娜．尼基多維奇共同策展，當代藝術博物館沙龍，貝爾格勒，2010）。

 💡Introduction
🔦Nam June Paik, Alternatives
After Nam June Paik’s death, the Korean government attempted to brand him as the
national hero for creativity. As Elizabeth Broun, the Director of the
Smithsonian American Art Museum said, “If Picasso stands astride the first half
of the 20th century like a colossus, Nam June Paik is the center of gravity for
all that was new in the second half of that 100-year span,” the inaugural
director of the Nam June Paik Art Center declared him as “the cultural icon whom
we can sell for millennia.” However, Paik’s massive pagoda of TV monitors at the
MMCA, The More The Better, came to a complete stop in February 2018, after a
short circuit at the top of the artwork was declared a fire hazard during a
safety inspection. He is heralded as a national hero, but his works have been
extinguished. He once left his famous comment on himself, “Yellow peril, C'est
Moi?” What could be an alternative understanding of the works of Nam June Paik?

 🔦The Illusion of the Fourth Industrial Revolution
The Korean government now advertises the Fourth Industrial Revolution as a
national opportunity. The Korean media artists are commissioned to install
large-scale installations under the catchphrases of the Fourth Industrial
Revolution, just as the MMCA hosts a media art exhibition to announce the
arrival of the Fourth Industrial Revolution. Is there really a Fourth Industrial
Revolution on the way? Is the development of science and technology truly
intended for a more comfortable and richer life? How could artists respond to
the current phenomenon of labor and social issues that was brought on by this
new development of technology?

 💡Lecturer
Ji Yoon Yang currently works as a director of Alternative Space LOOP, Seoul and
a co-director for Sound Effects Seoul. She was a chief curator of Mimesis Art
Museum and a director of Corner Art Space after participating in de Appel
Curatorial Programme 2008/2009. Yang participated as an editor/writer for
various publications including Talking about Curating, Sound+Art, Korean Museums
and Museums of the World and etc. Her interest lies in the communication with
the public for new social comments through artists and works that experiment

 📒活動說明
從現代主義到後現代主義，文學理論、歷史、人類學、藝術、電影、神學、哲學、語言學及教育等領域對於敍事的興趣愈趨高漲，但對何謂敍事並沒有很清楚的概念。敍事通常被理解為故事、藝術作品、表演、文學和電影的結果。然而，因為作者將事件詮釋為虛構的重建，敍事在被看見之前便已從意識層面形成。另外，在作者和觀眾透過此結果為媒介的溝通過程中，因為與觀眾自身的經驗相符，這些敍事因而被轉換為真實的經驗。本工作坊從概念的角度檢視三種類型的敍事如何形成，參與者也將探索不同的方式並實際執行每個步驟，找出敍事如何被用來發展自己的創作以及與他人的關係，並為生活創造意義。

 📒講者簡介
咸良娥目前在韓國、土耳其與荷蘭等三地居住及工作。她對於開創被視為社會評論的藝術實踐感到興趣，透過自己在不同社會生活的經驗，她特別關注個人生活及另類社會制度。咸良娥曾參與多次個展和聯展，包括穿越—正義（台北當代藝術館，2018）、亞洲藝術雙年展（國立台灣美術館，2017）、首爾媒體城市雙年展（首爾市立美術館，2016）、失調的和諧（善宰藝術中心、廣島現代美術館、關渡美術館，
2015-16）、
年度藝術家獎展（韓國國立現當代美術館，2013）、溝通的藝術：安力．薩拉、咸良娥、菲利浦．帕雷諾、侯黑．帕多（韓國國立現當代美術館，2013）、荒唐工廠裡的形容詞人生（善宰藝術中心，2010）、光州雙年展（2010）、上海雙年展（2008）、愛馬仕藝術獎展
（2008）。她曾獲得年度藝術獎（韓國文化藝術委員會，2005），並曾於2006至2007年參與阿姆斯特丹荷蘭皇家視覺藝術學院駐村計畫。

 📒Introduction
Coming from modernism to postmodernism, the interest in narratives is rising in
literature theory, history, anthropology, art, film, theology, philosophy,
linguistics and education, etc. But the concept of what narratives are is not
clear. Narrative is often understood as the result of stories, artwork,
performances, literature, and movies. However, narratives are formed from the
level of awareness before they are seen as a result, with the author making the
interpretation of events as a fictional reconstruction. Also, In the process of
communicating between the author and the audience through the medium of the
result, they are transformed into actual experiences as they meet with the
audience’s own experience. This workshop examines conceptually how these three
forms of narratives are organized. Later, participants will explore ways to
actually implement each process to find out how narratives can be used to
develop their own creative activities and relationships with others, and to give
meaning to life.

 📒Lecturer
Yang Ah Ham Lives and works in Korea, Turkey and the Netherland. Her interest
lies in developing an art practice that can be considered as a mode of social
criticism, while focusing on individual lives and alternative social systems
through her own experience of different societies. Yang Ah Ham has been
exhibited in many solo and group shows including Trans – Justice, (Taipei MOCA
2018), Asia Art Biennale (Taiwan national museum of fine arts, 2017), Meidacity
Seoul Biennale (SeMA, 2016), Discordant Harmony (Art Sonje Center, Hiroshima
MOCA, Taipei Kuandu Museum, 2015-16), Artist of the year prize show (MMCA,
2013), Art of Communication: Anri Sala, Yang Ah Ham, Philippe Parreno, Jorge
Pardo (MMCA Deoksugung, 2011), Adjective Life in the Nonsense Factory, (Art
Sonje Center, 2010), Gwangju Biennale (2010), Shanghai Biennale(2008), Hermes
art prize show (2008). She has won Art of the Year Award, (Arts Council of
Korea, 2005). Ham participated in Rijksakademie residency in Amsterdam in
2006-2007.

 《我的身體是一座酷兒史博物館》

 
這件作品的思考起點是，文件與檔案作為歷史的累積在博物館機構中被展示的方法與姿態。而身體作為一具個人或集體歷史的載體，如何成為一個敘事空間、一間檔案室，甚至是一間歷史博物館。

 
當一具酷兒身體作為一間酷兒史博物館，《我的身體是一座酷兒史博物館》透過扮裝、舞蹈、說書、歌唱、工作坊、討論等行動，展演性別政治的流動與認同，邀請觀眾造訪並參與在一場又一場的臨時聚會裡，進入一間博物館的身體，也進入他們或我們的身體的歷史片段，一同檢視流行文化、社會變遷、教育制度等文化框架如何形塑了此時此刻次的酷兒場景。

 概念、導演：林人中
表演者：張可揚、許生翰、李頌恩、黃家曄、簡詩翰、黃國瑞.

 《My body is a queer history museum》

 The notion of performing archives as interpreting historical accumulations in
museum setting shapes this work, in which an individual body as a historical
embodiment can be transformed into a spatial narration, an archive, and even a
history museum. 

 Through dragging, dancing, story-telling, singing, workshop and conversation,
My body is a queer history museum performs fluidity and identities of gender
politics presented by a group of performers individually and collectively.
Audience members are invited to visit and participate in a series of temporary
assemblies, together entering a museum's body as well as fragmentary memories
fragments of one’s body and then charting what has argubly shaped the current
queer scene right here and now. 
--
Concept and direction: River Lin 
Performers: Chang Ko-Yang, Hsu Sheng-Han , Chien Shih-Han, Huang Gia-Yeh,
Sherwin Chimera, Lee Song-En.

 🌈藝術家簡介：

 林人中River Lin 
行為藝術家林人中的作品經常將藝術家的身體勞動刻畫在與時間、物件、展覽場域、觀眾參與或特定文化脈絡的關係情境中，去探索藝術家的身體如何作為一個生產意義的器具，及表演作為一種媒介如何轉化及擴延觀眾對日常生活及藝術的感官經驗。

 
近期作品曾受邀於各地機構呈現，包括巴黎東京宮、法國舞蹈中心、布魯塞爾龐畢度中心、香港M+視覺文化博物館、蘇黎世宣言雙年展、亞洲當代藝術週、芬蘭ANTI當代藝術節、2016台北雙年展、及雪梨現場藝術節等。

 林人中目前往返巴黎及臺北之間生活與工作。

 River Lin is an artist whose work is performance-based in gallery settings. In
his work, the artist’s body is often staged and situated in relation to time,
objects, surroundings, audience engagement, or specific cultural contexts. The
main concern has revolved around exploring how the artist’s body can produce
discourse and social meaning, and how performance as a medium can transform
viewers’ sensations and experiences with art. 

 River’s work has been presented by international institutions, including the
Palais de Tokyo and Centre National de la Danse in Paris, the KANAL Centre
Pompidou and KAAI Theatre in Brussels, Manifesta 11 in Zurich, Asia Contemporary
Art Week, ANTI Contemporary Art Festival in Kuopio, the M+ Museum in Hong Kong,
2016 Taipei Biennial and the Liveworks Festival in Sydney among others. 

 River Lin currently lives and works between Paris and Taipei.

🍉2019國際對等交換駐村計畫 
🍉澳洲RMIT藝術家KBT駐館創作呈現簡介

 這次在關渡美術館駐館的創作計畫是呈現一部實驗性的影像作品《你說我迷》，該作品邀請數位徵選者在作品中演出。

 
作品靈感源自一位堅稱自己學英文，只靠三部電影的台灣友人:猜火車（1995）、鬥陣俱樂部（1999）及洛基恐怖秀（1975）。這三部電影共同以一種反動、反正統、權利剝奪的姿態呼應現況。

 為回應此靈感，我們重新詮釋三部台灣電影中的幾個場景，牯嶺街少年殺人事件(1991)、戲夢人生(1993)及天邊一朵雲(2005)。

 透過這次通過這項創作計畫，我們專注研究於透過語言以外的分享和學習去了解事物。 最後發現我們是以局外人的視點觀看整個做創作過程中。

 🍉2019Kuandu Exchange Program
🍉Australian Artists from RMIT, KBT Residency Project Intro

 We have made an experimental film for the gallery here at KdMoFA, and had
looked for people to perform in the film which is titled: "You say Phonetic, I
say Fanatic."

 The inspiration for this project is a Taiwanese friend who insists she learnt
to speak English purely through watching only three films over and over again.
Trainspotting (1995) Fight Club (1999) and The Rocky Horror Picture Show (1975).
These films share a reactionary, countercultural stance and a disenfranchisement
with the status quo.

 In response, we are reinterpreting scenes from three Taiwanese films as the
basis of a film project: A Brighter Summer Day (1991), The Puppetmaster (1993),
and The Wayward Cloud (2005).

 Through this activity; we’re interested in what else we can share and learn
beyond language. In doing so we acknowledge that our perspective is an
outsider’s vision.
